book.title: Sweeter off the Vine: Fruit Desserts for Every Season

review.body: I knew I would love this book as soon as I held it in my hands. It always amazes me just how many cookbooks I can fall in love with and add to my collection; I own so many yet every new beautiful one is welcomed into my library! This cookbook is not only lovely, it looks very useful and practical...
A Kennedy assassination conspiracy that is almost believable

book.title: Goodnight Punpun Omnibus (2-in-1 Edition), Vol. 1 (Goodnight Punpun Omnibus, #1)

review.body: I don't know. I was expecting something racier for a start. This is an angst-ridden coming of age story that takes Punpun through approx. two years of his life starting with his father nearly killing his mother in a domestic dispute, spending time with his uncle while father is in jail and mother...

Excellent story! Characters are well written and story holds you right to the end! This was a first for me with James Thayer,but not the last!

الأرقش هو شخص يجهل من هو، وأين وُلد، ومن أبوه، ومن هي أمه . وهو إنسان صامت ينتمي إلي نصف الإنسانية الساكت كما يحلو له أن يصف نفسه . وهو مع صموته الظاهري الخارجي يغرق في حوار داخلي قائم ومستمر ومتصل بينه وبين نفسه يهدف بالأساس إلي معرفة ذاته . والمعرفة المقصودة هنا ليست معرفة نشأته ومكان ولادته وا...
A wordy but charming book, along the lines of Anne of Green Gables or Little House on the Prairie. It has a cozy narrator feature.
Michele's book.

I started this as soon as I finished the first book in the series. I love them and don't want to do anything else until I'm done reading.

Wonderful book

Terrific imaginative story of learning life (many times over) by being a dog learning its purpose in life. Love and loyalty.

book.title: The Angel and the Cross (The Guardian Angel #3)

review.body: Possibly the best one of the trilogy, it takes the protagonist, and the reader, right to the foot of cross in awe of the work of God in that wondrous time.
4.5 stars
I quite like how Douglas Coupland writes. This is a good one.
A different read for me. But enjoyed it.
Great book. I really like this whole series.
A really beautiful story about friendship, life and what comes after.

book.title: Beauty and the Bull Rider (Hotel Rodeo, #3)

review.body:
Originally published at Reading Reality

Delaney McCall has been an important secondary character in the first two Hotel Rodeo books, because she’s an important person in Ty Morgan’s life. But her introduction in Hell on Heels may not dispose readers any too kindly towards Ty’s ex-wife.

It’s pretty...

book.title: The Black Swan: The Impact of the Highly Improbable

review.body:
One of the lessons from the global financial crisis (known in the US as the Great Recession) is that people can confuse the improbable with the impossible. As Taleb argues, "Black Swan logic makes what you don't know far more relevant that what you do know."
